intro: Cenolophon vitellinum, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and prefers partial to full shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Cenolophon vitellinum is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits to pollinators.
